physdesc.extent: Of the 127 digital objects, 117 have extent information and comprise 1,218 files.
Of the 127 digital objects, 117 have extent information and comprise 4.41 GB.

did.abstract: This collection contains materials related to the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company, such as scripts, promotional posters and publications, administrative records, event recordings, and web crawls.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into six series: I. Administrative materials; II. Productions; III. Web crawls; IV. Additional accessions; V. 2015 accessions; and VI. 2017 accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in the spring of 2003, Bare Bodkin Theater Company is an organization dedicated to providing an outlet for student playwrights and directors to produce their work and other experimental works on and off campus. In addition to putting on student-written productions and writing workshops, Bare Bodkin hosts a 10-minute play festival every fall based on scripts from the Playwrighting I class. The name is taken from Mark Twain's The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, and refers to threadless sewing needle head.

According to their constitution, the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company is charged with increasing the amount of experimental and student written and directed theatre throughout the Tufts' Medford/Somerville campus and in the surrounding communities as a means of generating more interest in the theatrical arts and supporting the incredible talents of primarily unrecognized artists. Additionally, there is a need on and off campus to provide theatre spaces for all interested directors. The company strives to accommodate the artistic visions of these students and to produce performances at Tufts that would otherwise not get the opportunity to perform because of their experimental nature.

All company members will be current Tufts students. Membership is awarded to students who attend one quarter of all general meetings, two of which can include the proposal meetings, and are involved in at least one company production.
Bare Bodkins is closely affiliated with the Pen, Paint, and Pretzels theater group, however, their funding is provided by the Tufts Community Union.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: First transfer of materials to the DCA May, 2013.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: 2015 accessions and 2017 accessions were processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Jane Kelly in 2020 -- 2021. Materials were bagged using Bagger and copied to Box for access. A file-level inventory was created, and series and collection-level description were updated at the time of processing. Original order and file titles have been maintained.
Web sites were crawled by Archive-It. Web crawl information updated in finding aid annually.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company, such as scripts, promotional posters and publications, administrative records, event recordings, and web crawls that date from 2003 -- 2019. Also included are artist in residence documents, constitutional changes, photographs, planning documents, and meeting minutes.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Bare Bodkin Theatre Company, 2015, accessions 2016.018 and 2016.026.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series contains three subseries, Photographs and administrative files, circa 2007 -- 2013; Photographs and administrative files, 2013 -- 2014; and Administrative and production files. It is arranged in the order in which it was received.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Jane Kelly in 2020 -- 2021. Materials were bagged using Bagger and copied to Box for access. A file-level inventory was created, and series and collection-level description were updated at the time of processing. Original order and file titles have been maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative and production files created by members of the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company between 2007 and 2015. The bulk of the material is photographs of workshops, productions, and other events organized by the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company. The predominant file type in this series is JPEG.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Bare Bodkin Theatre Company, 2015, accession 2016.018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains administrative and production files created by members of the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company between 2007 and 2013. The bulk of the material is photographs of workshops, productions, and other events organized by the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative and production files created by members of the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company between 2014 and 2015. These records include photographs and planning documents related to workshops, productions, and other Bare Bodkin events; meeting minutes; logo redesign options; publicity photographs; production schedules; and constitutional changes. The predominant file type in this series is JPEG.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Jane Kelly in 2020 -- 2021. Materials were bagged using Bagger and copied to Box for access. A file-level inventory was created, and series and collection-level description were updated at the time of processing. Original order and file titles have been maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative and production files created by members of the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company between 2015 and 2017. These records include photographs and planning documents related to workshops, productions, and other Bare Bodkin events; artists in residence documents; general interest meeting material; meeting minutes; and website content. The predominant file formats in this series include the following, in order of prevalence: JPEG, Word documents, Excel files, and MPEG.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is arranged in the order in which it was received.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Photoshop metadata files (.xmp), Nikon raw image files (.NEF), and empty directories in Bodkin Major were deaccessioned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative and production files created by members of the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company between 2015 and 2016. These records include photographs and planning documents related to workshops, productions, and other Bare Bodkin events; artists in residence documents; general interest meeting material; meeting minutes; and website content. The predominant file formats in this series include the following, in order of prevalence: Word documents, JPEG, and Excel files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This sub-series is arranged in the order in which it was received.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Copyrighted music saved with Bodkin Major files was deaccessioned and a file list was retained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative and production files created by members of the Bare Bodkin Theatre Company between 2016 and 2017. These records include photographs and planning documents related to workshops, productions, and other Bare Bodkin events; artists in residence documents; Board meeting minutes; budgets; constitutional changes; and general interest meeting material. The predominant file formats in this series include the following, in order of prevalence: JPEG, Word documents, and MPEG.
